page.title: 13Religion
page.content:
In our kilometre square which covers Aldgate East and parts of Whitechapel and Stepney, we have the recently completed East London Mosque which reflects the largely Muslim character of this part of the borough. There are several small mosques too.
Aldgate East has always had a mainly immigrant population due to its proximity to the docks and also historically being the area just outside the city gate. This is evident even now through the variety of non- conformist churches still operative here, including methodist / baptist missions, Salvation Army Citadel and Hostel, Jewish Synagogue and the German Church and Hostel of St. Boniface.
